name: William
originNotes: Germanic roots, English royalty. A consistently popular name for centuries.
famous_namesakes: William Shakespeare (playwright), Prince William (Duke of Cambridge), Bill Gates (entrepreneur), William Wordsworth (poet)

name: Olivia
originNotes: Latin origin, popularized by Shakespeare in 'Twelfth Night'.
famous_namesakes: Olivia Newton-John (singer/actress), Olivia Wilde (actress), Olivia Colman (actress)

name: Arthur
originNotes: Celtic/Roman roots, legendary king of Britain.
famous_namesakes: King Arthur (legendary figure), Arthur Conan Doyle (author), Arthur Miller (playwright)

name: Isla
originNotes: Scottish river/island name. Gained popularity in recent years.
famous_namesakes: Isla Fisher (actress)

name: Ezra
originNotes: Hebrew origin, prominent biblical prophet and scribe.
famous_namesakes: Ezra Pound (poet), Ezra Koenig (musician), Ezra Miller (actor)

name: Luna
originNotes: Latin origin, Roman goddess of the moon. Popular in literature and recently surged in usage.
famous_namesakes: Luna Lovegood (Harry Potter character), Luna Blaise (actress)

name: Caspian
originNotes: Place name (Caspian Sea), popularized by C.S. Lewis' 'Chronicles of Narnia'.
famous_namesakes: Prince Caspian (Chronicles of Narnia character)

name: Seraphina
originNotes: Hebrew origin, referring to a high order of angels. Elegant and uncommon.
famous_namesakes: Seraphina Affleck (daughter of Ben Affleck and Jennifer Garner)

name: Rowan
originNotes: Gaelic (Irish/Scottish) origin, a nature name with a gentle sound.
famous_namesakes: Rowan Atkinson (actor), Rowan Blanchard (actress)

name: Theodore
originNotes: Greek origin, a classic name that has seen a resurgence.
famous_namesakes: Theodore Roosevelt (US President), Dr. Seuss (Theodor Geisel, author), Theodore Dreiser (novelist)

name: Genevieve
originNotes: Germanic/French origin, patron saint of Paris. Elegant and timeless.
famous_namesakes: Saint Genevieve (patron saint of Paris), Genevieve Bujold (actress)

name: Phoenix
meaning: Mythical bird of rebirth; dark red.
originNotes: Greek origin, symbolizing immortality and renewal. Also a place name.
famous_namesakes: Phoenix, Arizona (city), River Phoenix (actor), Joaquin Phoenix (actor)

name: Jasper
originNotes: Persian origin, a gemstone name. Sophisticated and increasingly popular.
famous_namesakes: Jasper Johns (artist), Jasper Fforde (author)

name: Willow
originNotes: English nature name, associated with grace and elegance.
famous_namesakes: Willow Smith (singer/actress), Willow Rosenberg (Buffy the Vampire Slayer character)

name: Silas
originNotes: Latin origin (from Silvanus), biblical name (companion of Paul).
famous_namesakes: Silas Marner (novel character), Silas Weir Mitchell (actor)

name: Aurora
originNotes: Latin origin, Roman goddess of the dawn. Also linked to the Aurora Borealis.
famous_namesakes: Aurora (Sleeping Beauty), Aurora Aksnes (singer AURORA)

name: August
originNotes: Latin origin (Augustus), a month name and a title for Roman emperors.
famous_namesakes: August Wilson (playwright), August Strindberg (playwright), Princess Eugenie's son August Brooksbank

name: Juniper
originNotes: Latin origin, a spirited nature name.
famous_namesakes: Juniper (saint), commonly used as a modern nature name

name: Eleanor
originNotes: Greek origin (Helen) or Germanic (Aliénor), via French royalty. A timeless classic.
famous_namesakes: Eleanor Roosevelt (First Lady of the US), Eleanor of Aquitaine (Queen of France and England)

name: Finnian
originNotes: Irish origin, saint's name. A more elaborate version of Finn.
famous_namesakes: Saint Finnian of Clonard

name: Penelope
originNotes: Greek mythology (Odysseus' faithful wife). Classic, charming, and popular.
famous_namesakes: Penelope Cruz (actress), Penelope Wilton (actress)

name: Asher
originNotes: Hebrew origin, one of Jacob's sons in the Old Testament.
famous_namesakes: Asher Roth (rapper), Asher Angel (actor)

name: Violet
originNotes: Latin origin, a classic floral name that has regained popularity.
famous_namesakes: Violet Jessop (Titanic survivor), Violet Bonham Carter (politician)

name: Rhys
originNotes: Welsh origin, a strong and sleek unisex choice.
famous_namesakes: Rhys Ifans (actor), Rhys Darby (comedian), Reese Witherspoon (actress, uses different spelling)

name: Sebastian
originNotes: Greek origin (from Sebastos), popular internationally, associated with Saint Sebastian.
famous_namesakes: Saint Sebastian (martyr), Sebastian Vettel (F1 driver), Sebastian Bach (musician)

name: Freya
originNotes: Norse mythology goddess of love, beauty, and fertility. Strong and feminine.
famous_namesakes: Freya Allan (actress), Freya Ridings (singer)

name: Kai
meaning: Sea (Hawaiian), Willow Tree (Navajo), Keeper of Keys (Germanic), Rejoice (Yoruba).
originNotes: Multicultural origins, short, sleek, and popular.
famous_namesakes: Kai Ryssdal (radio host), Kai Greene (bodybuilder)

name: Caleb
meaning: Devotion to God, whole heart, faithful.
originNotes: Hebrew origin, one of the twelve spies sent by Moses into Canaan.
famous_namesakes: Caleb Landry Jones (actor), Caleb Followill (musician)

name: Evangeline
originNotes: Greek origin, popularized by Longfellow's epic poem. Romantic and elegant.
famous_namesakes: Evangeline Lilly (actress), Evangeline Booth (Salvation Army General)

name: Orion
originNotes: Greek mythology, a prominent constellation named after a mythical hunter.
famous_namesakes: Orion (mythological hunter)

name: Maximilian
originNotes: Latin origin, popular in Germany and Austria, associated with emperors.
famous_namesakes: Maximilian I (Holy Roman Emperor), Maximilian Schell (actor)

name: Sophie
originNotes: Greek origin, internationally popular classic.
famous_namesakes: Sophie Scholl (German anti-Nazi activist), Sophie Turner (actress), Sophie Marceau (actress)

name: Leon
originNotes: Greek origin, short, strong, and internationally recognized.
famous_namesakes: Leon Trotsky (revolutionary), Leon Panetta (US politician), Leon Bridges (musician)

name: Emilia
originNotes: Latin origin, classic and elegant, popular in many European countries.
famous_namesakes: Emilia Clarke (actress), Emilia Earhart (aviator, variant spelling)

name: Finn
originNotes: Irish origin (Fionn), popular in Germany and Scandinavia. Also an English surname.
famous_namesakes: Finn Wolfhard (actor), Finn Jones (actor), Huckleberry Finn (literary character)

name: Lina
originNotes: Short form, various origins (e.g. Carolina, Angelina). Simple and sweet.
famous_namesakes: Lina Medina (youngest confirmed mother), Lina Morgana (singer)

name: Paul
originNotes: Latin origin, biblical (Apostle Paul). A timeless international classic.
famous_namesakes: Paul McCartney (musician), Paul Newman (actor), Pope John Paul II

name: Hannah
originNotes: Hebrew origin, biblical (mother of Samuel). A popular palindrome name.
famous_namesakes: Hannah Arendt (philosopher), Hannah Montana (TV character), Hannah Simone (actress)

name: Felix
originNotes: Latin origin, implies good fortune. Popular in many countries.
famous_namesakes: Felix Mendelssohn (composer), Felix Baumgartner (skydiver), Felix the Cat (cartoon character)

name: Clara
originNotes: Latin origin, a classic name known for its simplicity and elegance.
famous_namesakes: Clara Schumann (composer/pianist), Clara Barton (founder of American Red Cross)

name: Anton
originNotes: Latin origin (Antonius family name). Strong and classic, common in Europe.
famous_namesakes: Anton Chekhov (playwright), Anton Bruckner (composer), Anton Yelchin (actor)

name: Ida
originNotes: Germanic origin. Short, sweet, and vintage, making a comeback.
famous_namesakes: Ida Lupino (actress/director), Ida B. Wells (journalist/activist)

name: Konrad
originNotes: Germanic origin, a traditional name with a strong meaning.
famous_namesakes: Konrad Adenauer (German Chancellor), Konrad Lorenz (zoologist)

name: Greta
originNotes: German short form of Margaret. Chic and classic.
famous_namesakes: Greta Garbo (actress), Greta Thunberg (activist), Greta Gerwig (director)

name: Anselm
originNotes: Germanic origin, a distinguished and rare saint's name.
famous_namesakes: Saint Anselm of Canterbury (philosopher/theologian), Anselm Kiefer (artist)

name: Lieselotte
meaning: Combination of Liese (God is my oath) and Charlotte (free man).
originNotes: German compound name, charmingly vintage.
famous_namesakes: Liselotte Pulver (actress)

name: Elias
originNotes: Hebrew origin (Elijah), popular in Germany and other European countries.
famous_namesakes: Elias Canetti (Nobel laureate), Elias Koteas (actor)

name: Johanna
originNotes: Hebrew origin, feminine form of Johannes (John). Classic and widely used.
famous_namesakes: Johanna Spyri (author of 'Heidi'), Johanna von Koczian (actress)

name: Oskar
originNotes: Germanic/Irish origin. Strong and classic, common in Scandinavia and Germany.
famous_namesakes: Oskar Schindler (industrialist), Oskar Kokoschka (artist), Oskar Werner (actor)

name: Mathilda
originNotes: Germanic origin. A vintage name that feels both strong and sweet.
famous_namesakes: Empress Matilda (English royal), Mathilda (Roald Dahl character)

name: Frederik
originNotes: Germanic origin, royal connections in Scandinavia and Germany.
famous_namesakes: Frederik, Crown Prince of Denmark, Frederik Pohl (sci-fi author)

name: Rosalie
originNotes: Latin origin (Rosalia). Romantic and floral, increasingly popular.
famous_namesakes: Rosalie Hale (Twilight character), Rosalie Crutchley (actress)

name: Hugo
originNotes: Germanic origin. Short, strong, and internationally recognized.
famous_namesakes: Victor Hugo (author), Hugo Weaving (actor), Hugo Boss (fashion designer)

name: Alma
originNotes: Multiple origins (Latin, Spanish, Hebrew, Germanic). Short, sweet, and vintage.
famous_namesakes: Alma Mahler (composer/artist), Alma Reville (film editor, wife of Hitchcock)

name: Leonardo
originNotes: Germanic roots, famously associated with Leonardo da Vinci.
famous_namesakes: Leonardo da Vinci (artist/inventor), Leonardo DiCaprio (actor)

name: Sofia
originNotes: Greek origin, popular worldwide, elegant and classic.
famous_namesakes: Sofia Loren (actress), Sofia Coppola (director), Queen Sofia of Spain

name: Francesco
originNotes: Latin origin, associated with St. Francis of Assisi, very popular in Italy.
famous_namesakes: St. Francis of Assisi, Pope Francis, Francesco Totti (footballer)

name: Giulia
originNotes: Latin origin, Italian form of Julia. Classic and widely loved.
famous_namesakes: Giulia Farnese (Italian noblewoman), Giulia Steingruber (gymnast)

name: Lorenzo
originNotes: Latin origin, a romantic and classic Italian name.
famous_namesakes: Lorenzo de' Medici (Italian statesman), Lorenzo Lamas (actor)

name: Chiara
originNotes: Italian form of Clara, associated with St. Clare of Assisi.
famous_namesakes: St. Clare of Assisi, Chiara Mastroianni (actress), Chiara Ferragni (fashion influencer)

name: Matteo
originNotes: Italian form of Matthew (Hebrew origin). Popular and classic.
famous_namesakes: Matteo Renzi (Italian politician), Matteo Berrettini (tennis player)

name: Beatrice
originNotes: Latin origin, famously Dante's muse in 'The Divine Comedy'.
famous_namesakes: Beatrice Portinari (Dante's muse), Princess Beatrice of York

name: Elio
originNotes: Italian/Spanish from Greek Helios (sun god). Short, bright, and uncommon.
famous_namesakes: Elio Germano (actor), Elio de Angelis (F1 driver)

name: Allegra
originNotes: Italian word name, also a musical term. Spirited and elegant.
famous_namesakes: Allegra Versace (Italian heiress), Allegra Kent (ballerina)

name: Marco
originNotes: Latin origin, related to Mars, the Roman god of war. Classic and strong.
famous_namesakes: Marco Polo (explorer), Marco Materazzi (footballer)

name: Alessia
originNotes: Italian feminine form of Alexis (Greek origin). Graceful and popular.
famous_namesakes: Alessia Cara (singer), Alessia Marcuzzi (TV presenter)

name: Riccardo
originNotes: Italian form of Richard (Germanic origin). Strong and classic.
famous_namesakes: Riccardo Muti (conductor), Riccardo Scamarcio (actor)

name: Ginevra
meaning: White shadow, white wave; juniper tree.
originNotes: Italian form of Guinevere (Welsh). Elegant and increasingly popular.
famous_namesakes: Ginevra de' Benci (subject of da Vinci painting), Ginevra Elkann (film director)

name: Vittorio
originNotes: Italian form of Victor (Latin). Strong and classic.
famous_namesakes: Vittorio De Sica (film director), Vittorio Gassman (actor)

name: Isabella
meaning: Pledged to God; God is my oath.
originNotes: Hebrew origin, Italian/Spanish form of Elizabeth. Royal and classic.
famous_namesakes: Isabella Rossellini (actress), Queen Isabella I of Castile

name: Enzo
meaning: Home ruler (short form of Lorenzo/Vincenzo); giant (Germanic).
originNotes: Italian short form, also has Germanic roots. Popular and spirited.
famous_namesakes: Enzo Ferrari (founder of Ferrari), Enzo Maresca (football manager)

name: Cosima
originNotes: Italian feminine form of Cosmo (Greek). Uncommon and sophisticated.
famous_namesakes: Cosima Wagner (daughter of Liszt, wife of Wagner), Cosima von Bülow Pavoncelli

name: Mateo
originNotes: Hebrew origin (Matthew), very popular in Spanish-speaking countries.
famous_namesakes: Mateo Alemán (novelist), Mateo Kovačić (footballer), Mateo Gil (screenwriter)

name: Lucia
originNotes: Latin origin, classic and beautiful, associated with Saint Lucia.
famous_namesakes: Saint Lucia of Syracuse, Lucía Etxebarria (writer), Lucía Bosé (actress)

name: Santiago
originNotes: Hebrew/Spanish origin, patron saint of Spain and many other places.
famous_namesakes: Santiago Calatrava (architect), Santiago Ramón y Cajal (Nobel laureate), Santiago Bernabéu (Real Madrid figure)

name: Valeria
originNotes: Latin origin, popular in Spanish-speaking countries and Eastern Europe.
famous_namesakes: Valeria Mazza (model), Valeria Golino (actress), Valeria Lukyanova (model)

name: Hugo
originNotes: Germanic origin, popular in Spain and Latin America.
famous_namesakes: Hugo Sánchez (footballer), Hugo Chávez (Venezuelan president)

name: Martina
originNotes: Latin origin, popular in Spanish, Italian, and Slavic countries.
famous_namesakes: Martina Navratilova (tennis player), Martina McBride (singer), Martina Stoessel (actress/singer)

name: Javier
originNotes: Basque origin, associated with Saint Francis Xavier.
famous_namesakes: Javier Bardem (actor), Javier Sotomayor (high jumper), St. Francis Xavier

name: Camila
originNotes: Latin origin, popular in Spanish and Portuguese speaking countries.
famous_namesakes: Camila Cabello (singer), Camila Alves (model), Camila Mendes (actress)

name: Louis
originNotes: Germanic origin (Chlodowig), a classic French royal name.
famous_namesakes: King Louis XIV of France, Louis Armstrong (musician), Louis Vuitton (designer)

name: Camille
originNotes: Latin origin (Camillus), a popular unisex name in France.
famous_namesakes: Camille Pissarro (painter), Camille Claudel (sculptor), Camille Cottin (actress)

name: Gabriel
originNotes: Hebrew origin, an archangel in Abrahamic religions. Popular internationally.
famous_namesakes: Archangel Gabriel, Gabriel Byrne (actor), Gabriel García Márquez (author)

name: Léa
originNotes: Hebrew origin (Leah), popular in France and other European countries.
famous_namesakes: Léa Seydoux (actress), Lea Salonga (singer)

name: Antoine
originNotes: French form of Anthony (Latin origin). Classic and sophisticated.
famous_namesakes: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry (author), Antoine Griezmann (footballer)

name: Chloé
originNotes: Greek origin, a popular name in France and English-speaking countries.
famous_namesakes: Chloé (fashion house), Chloë Sevigny (actress), Khloé Kardashian (TV personality)

name: Jules
originNotes: French form of Julius (Latin origin). Classic and literary.
famous_namesakes: Jules Verne (author), Jules Bianchi (F1 driver), Jules Feiffer (cartoonist)

name: Manon
meaning: Wished-for child; rebellion; bitter (diminutive of Marie).
originNotes: French diminutive of Marie (Hebrew origin). Popular and charming.
famous_namesakes: Manon Lescaut (opera/novel character), Manon Fiorot (MMA fighter)

name: Haruto
meaning: Sunlight, soar/fly (陽翔); Spring, soar/fly (春翔); Clear, soar/fly (晴翔). Meaning depends on kanji.
originNotes: Popular Japanese name with various positive meanings based on kanji combinations.
famous_namesakes: Haruto Shirai (footballer)

name: Sakura
originNotes: A beloved Japanese name symbolizing beauty, renewal, and the transient nature of life.
famous_namesakes: Sakura Ando (actress), Sakura Miyawaki (singer)

name: Ren
meaning: Lotus (蓮); Love/romance (恋). Meaning depends on kanji.
originNotes: Popular unisex Japanese name with beautiful meanings.
famous_namesakes: Ren Osugi (actor), Ren Meguro (singer/actor)

name: Himari
meaning: Good hollyhock (陽葵); Sun, hollyhock (日葵). Meaning depends on kanji.
originNotes: Popular Japanese girls' name, often associated with sunshine and flowers.
famous_namesakes: Often used in fiction, real-life examples less prominent internationally.

name: Kenji
meaning: Intelligent second son (研二); Strong, healthy (健二). Meaning depends on kanji.
originNotes: Classic Japanese boys' name with strong, positive meanings.
famous_namesakes: Kenji Miyazawa (poet/author), Kenji Wu (singer)

name: Yumi
meaning: Beauty (美); Archery bow (弓); Abundant beauty (裕美). Meaning depends on kanji.
originNotes: Elegant Japanese girls' name with various beautiful meanings.
famous_namesakes: Yumi Matsutoya (singer), Yumi Yoshimura (singer, Puffy AmiYumi)

name: Daiki
meaning: Great radiance (大輝); Great tree (大樹); Great nobility (大貴). Meaning depends on kanji.
originNotes: Strong and popular Japanese boys' name.
famous_namesakes: Daiki Arioka (singer/actor), Daiki Kameda (boxer)

name: Akira
meaning: Bright, clear, intelligent (明); Autumn (秋). Meaning depends on kanji.
originNotes: Well-known unisex Japanese name, famously used by filmmaker Kurosawa.
famous_namesakes: Akira Kurosawa (film director), Akira Toriyama (manga artist)
